questions.question_text: The bond dissociation energy of B - F in BF3 is 646 kJ mol-1 whereas that of C - F in CF4 is 515 kj mol-1. The correct reason for higher B - F bond dissociation energy as compared to that of C - F is

option_texts.A: stronger $$\sigma$$ bond between B and F in BF_{3} as compared to that between C and F in CF_{4}
option_texts.B: significant $$p\pi - p\pi$$ interaction between B and F in BF_{3} whereas there is no possibility of such interaction between C and F in CF_{4}
option_texts.C: lower degree of $$p\pi - p\pi$$ interaction between B and F in BF_{3} than that between C and F in CF_{4}
option_texts.D: smaller size of B - atom as compared to that of C- atom.

Let $$A$$ be $$a\,2 	imes 2$$ matrix with real entries. Let $$I$$ be the $$2 	imes 2$$ identity matrix. Denote by tr$$(A)$$, the sum of diagonal entries of $$a$$. Assume that $${a^2} = I.$$ 

Statement-1 : If $$A 
e I$$ and $$A 
e  - I$$, then det$$(A)=-1$$

Statement- 2 : If $$A 
e I$$ and $$A 
e  - I$$, then tr $$(A)$$ $$ 
e 0$$.

option_texts.A: statement - 1 is false, statement -2 is true
option_texts.B: statement -1 is true, statement - 2 is true; statement - 2 is a correct explanation for statement - 1.
option_texts.C: statement - 1 is true, statement - 2 is true; statement - 2 is not a correct explanation for statement - 1.

Suppose the cubic $${x^3} - px + q$$ has three distinct real roots

option_texts.B: The cubic has minima at $$-\sqrt {{p \over 3}} $$ and maxima at $$\sqrt {{p \over 3}} $$

$$${1 \over {\sqrt 1 }} + {1 \over {\sqrt 2 }} + ........ + {1 \over {\sqrt n }} > \sqrt n .$$$
STATEMENT - 2 : For every natural number  $$n \ge 2,$$, 
$$$\sqrt {n\left( {n + 1} \right)}  < n + 1.$$$

 $$T = \left\{ {(x,y): x - y\,\,\,is\,\,an\,\,{\mathop{\rm int}} eger\,} \right\}$$,

option_texts.B: Both S and T are equivalence relation on R
option_texts.C: S is an equivalence relation on R but T is not
option_texts.D: T is an equivalence relation on R but S is not

Statement- 1:

Energy is released when heavy nuclei undergo fission or light nuclei undergo fusion and 
Statement- 2:

For heavy nuclei, binding energy per nucleon increases with increasing $$Z$$  while for light nuclei it decreases with increasing $$Z.$$

option_texts.B: Statement - $$1$$ is true, Statement - $$2$$ is true; Statement - $$2$$ is a correct explanation for Statement - $$1$$

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Consider a block of conducting material of resistivity $$'\rho '$$ shown in the figure. Current $$'I'$$ enters at $$'A'$$ and leaves from $$'D'$$. We apply superposition principle to find voltage $$'\Delta V'$$ developed between $$'B'$$ and $$'C'$$. The calculation is done in the following steps: 

(i) Take current $$'I'$$ entering from $$'A'$$ and assume it to spread over a hemispherical surface in the block.

(ii) Calculate field $$E(r)$$ at distance $$'r'$$ from A by using Ohm's law $$E = \rho j,$$ where $$j$$ is the current per unit area at $$'r'$$. 

(iii) From the $$'r'$$ dependence of $$E(r)$$, obtain the potential $$V(r)$$ at $$r$$. 

(iv) Repeat (i), (ii) and (iii) for current $$'I'$$ leaving $$'D'$$ and superpose results for $$'A'$$ and $$'D'.$$ 
 
$$\Delta V$$ measured between $$B$$ and $$C$$ is

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A body is at rest at $$x=0.$$ At $$t=0,$$ it starts moving in the positive $$x$$-direction with a constant acceleration. At the same instant another body passes through $$x=0$$ moving in the positive $$x$$ direction with a constant speed. The position of the first body is given by $${x_1}\left( t \right)$$ after time $$'t';$$ and that of the second body by $${x_2}\left( t \right)$$ after the same time interval. (ii) Calculate field $$E(r)$$ at distance $$'r'$$ from A by using Ohm's law $$E = \rho j,$$ where $$j$$ is the current per unit area at $$'r'$$.

(iv) Repeat (i), (ii) and (iii) for current $$'I'$$ leaving $$'D'$$ and superpose results for $$'A'$$ and $$'D'.$$

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
This question contains Statement - $$1$$ and Statement - $$2$$. of the four choices given after the statements, choose the one that best describes the two statements.


Statement - $$1$$:


For a mass $$M$$ kept at the center of a cube of side $$'a'$$, the flux of gravitational field passing through its sides $$4\,\pi \,GM.$$ 


Statement - 2:


If the direction of a field due to a point source is radial and its dependence on the distance $$'r'$$ from the source is given as $${1 \over {{r^2}}},$$ its flux through a closed surface depends only on the strength of the source enclosed by the surface and not on the size or shape of the surface.

option_texts.A: Statement - $$1$$ is false, Statement - $$2$$ is true
option_texts.B: Statement - $$1$$ is true, Statement - $$2$$ is true; Statement - $$2$$ is a correct explanation for Statement - $$1$$
option_texts.C: Statement - $$1$$ is true, Statement - $$2$$ is true; Statement - $$2$$ is not a correct explanation for Statement - $$1$$
option_texts.D: Statement - $$1$$ is true, Statement - $$2$$ is false
